title: Initial Launch
custom_preconds: Given the user installs Clubhouse app on device with minimum iOS 8.x or above (iPhone & iPod, does not support iPad)
custom_steps: When the user taps on the Clubhouse launcher icon for the first time
custom_expected: Then the user is brought to the Clubhouse app's MLB-branded Clubhouse splash screen which is not tappable

title: Splash Screen
custom_preconds: Ask dev team to set up config file in QA build for a Sponsorship spot to appear on the Splash screen
custom_steps: When the user is on the Splash Screen and it is configured so that we can sell a Sponsorship spot for Clubhouse
custom_expected: Then splash screen should include the logo once it's loaded, and delay dismissing the screen an extra 3 seconds to give the logo some time to display; logo is not tappable

title: Tutorial
custom_preconds:
Given the user has installed the app
and has launched for the first time
custom_steps: When the splash screen has passed
custom_expected: Then the user will be taken to the Tutorial

title: Tutorial, page 1
custom_preconds:
Given the user has installed the app
and is in the on-boarding process
custom_steps: When the user is on the Tutorial, page one
custom_expected:
Then the page will contain the following:
- Plain splash
- Animates with background
- Animates to include copy and button
- COPY (text color is white): Welcome to the MLB.com Clubhouse!
- BUTTON: Skip Tutorial [Skips user to home screen]

title: Tutorial, page 2
custom_preconds:
Given the user has installed the app
and is in the on-boarding process
custom_steps: When the user is on the Tutorial, page two
custom_expected:
Then the page will contain the following:
- Spinny gears on top
- COPY (text color is white):
To install the MLB.com Clubhouse Keyboard:
1. Go to Settings
2. Tap on General > Keyboard > Keyboards
3. Select Add New Keyboard
4. Select Clubhouse from the list
5. Turn on Allow Full Access
These instructions are available in the app settings should you need them again. 
- LEGAL COPY:
Full Access enables the appâ€™s GIF messaging to function properly. Except to transmit your messages, the app does not capture keystroke data and does not access, collect or transmit personal data stored on your device.
- BUTTON: Skip Tutorial [Skips user to home screen]

title: Tutorial, page 3
custom_preconds:
Given the user has installed the app
and is in the on-boarding process
custom_steps: When the user is on the Tutorial, page three
custom_expected:
Then the page page will contain the following:

a. 
- Shows first line of copy and standard keyboard
- COPY (text color is white): To use the Clubhouse Keyboard, tap and hold on the "Globe" key at the bottom left.
- IMAGE: [Shows keyboard]

b. 
- Animates to add second blurb of text and second keyboard screen
- COPY (text color is white): Select Clubhouse from the list.
- IMAGE: [Shows keyboard with Clubhouse in the list]

c. 
- Animates to show third line of text and Clubhouse Keyboard screenshot
- COPY (text color is white): Tap and hold the GIF or Sticker you want to use. Then paste it into your Messaging app.
- IMAGE: [Shows Clubhouse Keyboard screenshot]

title: Tutorial, page 4
custom_preconds:
Given the user has installed the app
and is in the on-boarding process
custom_steps: When the user is on the Tutorial, page four
custom_expected:
Then the page will contain the following:
- COPY (text color is white): When you find something you like, tap on it. Then tap "Add to My Content" to load it on to your MLB.com Clubhouse Keyboard.
- IMAGE: Logo
- BUTTON: Let's Get Started

title: Tutorial Ends
custom_preconds:
Given the user has installed the app
and is in the on-boarding process
custom_steps: When the Tutorial ends
custom_expected: Then the user is brought to the favorite team picker page

title: Team Picker
custom_preconds:
Given the user has installed the app
and is in the on-boarding process
custom_steps: When the user is on the favorite team picker page
custom_expected: Then the user will view all 30 teams categorized by league/division (AL East, AL Central, etc.)

title: No Favorite Team
custom_preconds:
Given the user has installed the app
and is in the on-boarding process
custom_steps: When the user does not select a team
custom_expected: Then no favorite team shall be designated

title: Next
custom_preconds:
Given the user has installed the app
and is in the on-boarding process
custom_steps: When the user taps on Next
custom_expected: The user is prompted with a Global push notifications pop-up on top of the Notifications page

title: Global Push Notification
custom_preconds:
Given the user has installed the app
and is in the on-boarding process
custom_steps: When the user is prompted with a Global push notifications pop-up
custom_expected:
Then the prompt will state the following:
Clubhouse would like to send you Notifications
Notifications may include alerts, sounds, and icon badges. These can be configured in Settings.

title: Don't Allow Push Notification
custom_preconds:
Given the user has installed the app
and is in the on-boarding process
custom_steps: When the user taps on Don't Allow for the Global Push Notifications
custom_expected: Then the pop-up will disappear and the user will have opted out and not receive Global push notifications

title: Allow Push Notification
custom_preconds:
Given the user has installed the app
and is in the on-boarding process
custom_steps: When the user taps on Ok for Global Push Notifications
custom_expected: Then the pop-up will disappear and the user will have signed up to receive Global push notifications

title: Notification
custom_preconds:
Given the user has installed the app
and is in the on-boarding process
custom_steps: When the user either accepts or rejects the Global Push Notifications from the pop-up
custom_expected: Then the user will be taken to the Notifications screen

title: Notifications Page
custom_preconds:
Given the user has installed the app
and is in the on-boarding process
custom_steps: When the user is on the Notifications screen
custom_expected:
Then the user will see the following:
List of 30 team clubs by division (AL East, AL Central, etc), No Favorite team shall be displayed/selected

title: Notification not Enabled
custom_preconds:
Given the user has installed the app
and is in the on-boarding process
custom_steps:
When the user is on the Notifications screen 
and does not enable notifications
custom_expected:
Then all team notifications are automatically turned off 
and receipt of notifications is disabled

title: Notification Enabled for a Team
custom_preconds:
Given the user has installed the app
and is in the on-boarding process
custom_steps:
When the user is on the Notifications screen
and enables notifications for a specific team
custom_expected:
Then that specific team notifications are automatically turned on 
and receipt of notifications is enabled

title: Done
custom_preconds:
Given the user has installed the app
and is in the on-boarding process
custom_steps: When the user taps on Done
custom_expected: Then the user is taken to the MLB Home page

title: MLB Home Page
custom_preconds:
Given the user has installed the app
and is in the on-boarding process
custom_steps: When the user is on the MLB Home page
custom_expected:
Then the home screen will contain:
- MLB logo static at the top

Two navigation links:
- Teams
- Categories ('All' is the default category)

Top of screen (center) has:
- GIFs (default toggle)
- Stickers (toggle)
- Search field

Bottom Toolbar:
- Home
- My Content
- At Bat
- Settings

custom_preconds:
Given the user has installed the app
and is in the on-boarding process
custom_steps: When the user is on the Notifications screen and only the selected favorite team notifications are automatically turned on

and receipt of notifications is enabled for that team

title: Launcher Icon
custom_preconds: Clubhouse app has been previously launched and closed
custom_steps: When the user taps on the launcher icon
custom_expected: Then the user is brought to the default MLB-branded Clubhouse splash screen

title: Splash Screen
custom_preconds:
Given the user had previously closed/killed the app 
and has launched the app again
custom_steps: When the user is on the Splash Screen and it is configured so that we can sell a Sponsorship spot for Clubhouse
custom_expected: Then splash screen should include the logo once it's loaded, and delay dismissing the screen an extra 3 seconds to give the logo some time to display; logo is not tappable

title: Leaving Splash Screen
custom_preconds:
Given the user had previously closed/killed the app 
and has launched the app again
custom_steps: When the user views the default MLB-branded Clubhouse splash screen
custom_expected: Then the user is taken to the Home page

title: Home Page
custom_preconds:
Given the user had previously closed/killed the app 
and has launched the app again
custom_steps: When the user is on the Home page
custom_expected:
Then

Static at the top:
- MLB logo (default if no team selected) 
OR
- Team logo (if favorite team selected)

Two navigation links:
- Teams
- Categories (Will say "All" if you are in the "All" view, 
which is the default)

Top of screen (center) has a toggle, the default toggle view is where you last were in the view:
- GIFs (with eight GIFs)
- Stickers (with eight Stickers)

title: Top Navigation
custom_preconds: Given the user launches the app and is on the home page
custom_steps: When the user views the top navigation
custom_expected:
Then the Top of screen has two nav links:
- Teams,
- Categories (Will say "All" if you are in the "All" view, which is the default)

Toggle view (center):
- GIFs
- Stickers

title: Bottom Navigation
custom_preconds: Given the user launches the app and is on the home page
custom_steps: When the user views the navigation toolbar at the bottom
custom_expected:
Then the user should see the following:
- Home
- My Content
- At Bat
- Settings

title: Home
custom_preconds: Given the user launches the app and is on the home page
custom_steps: When the user taps on the Home icon
custom_expected: Then the user is taken to the Home page (main feed view)

title: My Content
custom_preconds: Given the user launches the app and is on the home page
custom_steps: When the user taps on the My Content icon
custom_expected: Then the user is taken to the My Content page which contains all saved/stored GIFs and Stickers

title: At Bat installed
custom_preconds: Given the user launches the app and is on the home page
custom_steps: When the user taps on At Bat and has At Bat installed on the device
custom_expected: Then the user is taken to At Bat app

title: At Bat Not Installed
custom_preconds: Given the user launches the app and is on the home page
custom_steps: When the user taps on At Bat and has At Bat is not installed on the device
custom_expected: Then the user is taken to the App store

title: At Bat encounters issues
custom_preconds: Given the user launches the app and is on the home page
custom_steps: When the user taps on At Bat and experiences issues (not taken to At Bat or not taken to App Store)
custom_expected: Then the user will see in the content area of the user's screen a default MLB.com At Bat logo / watermark and a button 'MLB.com At Bat'

title: Settings
custom_steps: When the user taps on the Settings icon, style gear icon
custom_expected: Then the user is taken to the Settings page

title: Favorite Team
custom_preconds: Given the user is on the Home page
custom_steps: When the user is on Home screen (main feed view) and has selected a favorite team
custom_expected:
Then the user will be taken to the favorite team home feed, GIFs or Stickers feed, following whichever content type user was on. Top of screen has:

Static at the top:
- Team logo (if favorite team selected)

Two navigation links:
- Teams
- Categories (Will say "All" if you are in the "All" view, 
which is the default)

Top of screen (center) has a toggle the width of the search field, the default toggle view is where you last were in the view:
- GIFs (with eight GIFs)
- Stickers (with eight Stickers)

Top of screen, below the GIFs/Stickers toggle:
-Search Field

title: MLB Team
custom_preconds: Given the user is on the Home page
custom_steps: When the user has not selected a team and MLB appears as a default
custom_expected:
Then the user will be taken to MLB home feed, GIFs or Stickers feed, following whichever content type user was on. Top of screen has:

Static at the top:
- MLB logo

Two nav links:
- Teams,
- Categories (Will say "All" if you are in the "All" view, which is the default)

Top of screen (center) has a toggle the width of the search field, the default toggle view is where you last were in the view:
- GIFs
- Stickers

Top of screen, below the GIFs/Stickers toggle:
-Search Field

title: Team Filter
custom_preconds: Given the user is on the Home page
custom_steps: When the user taps on the Team filter
custom_expected: Then the teams (MLB/General option followed by 30 teams) will be listed by division with the logo on the left, will mirror At Bat app (verify team names and logos), and will not have gear icon next to each club name

title: Selecting Team from Team Filter
custom_preconds: Given the user is on the Home page
custom_steps: When the user selects a team from the Team filter at the top of the screen
custom_expected: Then the selected Team word mark logo appears at the top of the screen

title: Team Selected from Team Filter
custom_preconds: Given the user is on the Home page
custom_steps: When the user has already selected a Team from the Team filter
custom_expected:
Then the user will be taken to that team's home feed, GIFs or Stickers feed, following whichever content type user was on when the user selected that team. Top of screen has:

Static at the top:
- Team logo

Two nav links: 
- Teams,
- Categories (Will say "All" if you are in the "All" view, which is the default)

Toggle (center):
- GIFs
- Stickers

title: All Categories
custom_preconds: Given the user is on the Home page
custom_steps: When the user taps on 'All' Categories filter
custom_expected:
Then the user will be taken to categories screen of whatever content the user was in:
- GIFs categories modal (if user was on GIF toggle)
- Stickers categories modal (if user was on Sticker toggle)

title: Selecting a Cagetory
custom_preconds: Given the user is on the Home page
custom_steps: When the user taps on a category
custom_expected: Then the user is taken to the content type and category

title: Endless Scroll of GIFs
custom_preconds: Given the user is on the Home page
custom_steps: When the user views the endless scroll of the automatic feed of the most recent GIFs
custom_expected: Then this will hold static spots within the top eight, the GIFs will auto play in live view, the user will be able to scroll endlessly

title: Categories Filter
custom_preconds: Given the user is on the Home page
custom_steps: When the user taps on the Categories filter ('All' is the default)
custom_expected: Then the user is taken to the Categories list view

title: Endless Scroll of Stickers
custom_preconds: Given the user is on the Home page
custom_steps: When the user views the endless scroll of the automatic feed of the most recent Stickers
custom_expected: Then this will hold static spots within the top eight and the user will be able to scroll endlessly

custom_preconds: Given the user is on the Home page
custom_steps: When the user is on the Categories menu and navigates to a GIFs category
custom_expected: Then the user is taken to the GIF stream of the selected category which appear in reverse chronological order, top of the screen has the teams links and categories link

title: GIF
custom_preconds: Given the user is on the Home page
custom_steps: When the user taps on a GIF
custom_expected: Then the user will be taken to the Details View

custom_steps: When the user is on the Categories menu and navigates to a Stickers category
custom_expected: Then the user is taken to the Sticker stream of the selected category (which appear in the order they were added to the list in homebase), top of the screen has the teams links and categories link

custom_steps: When the user views the Stickers
custom_expected: Then the Sticker will appear in the feed and the user will have the option to pin it

title: Stickers
custom_preconds: Given the user is on the Home page
custom_steps: When the user taps on a Sticker
custom_expected: Then the user will be taken to the Details View
